events.title: UN human rights rapporteur applies to join legal case against protest laws – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Albanese defends Isaac Herzog’s Australia visit as federal MP joins calls to rescind invitation Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Anne Aly says it is ‘huge relief’ there were no casualties at Perth Invasion Day rally Anne Aly, the minister for multicultural affairs, as well as a counter-terrorism expert, says she is relieved no one was hurt in the potential terrorist act as an improvised explosive device was thrown into a crowd at an Invasion Day rally in Perth. Well, first of all, I guess it was relief, really, that nobody was hurt. When you throw an IED, an improvised explosive device, into a crowd, and if it’s a successful, it could have been a mass casualty attack. So the huge relief that nobody was hurt. The distinction we need to draw here when we say David Littleproud has done X, Y, Z … David Littleproud [has] only done that because the room has agreed to do that and he has requested what is the room’s view … David Littleproud has never run off and done anything unless he has had the complete support of the Nationals party room. Continue reading...

events.title: Albanese defends Isaac Herzog’s Australia visit as federal MP joins calls to rescind invitation
events.description: Independent MP Sophie Scamps joins Labor’s Friends of Palestine group and Greens senator Mehreen Faruqi in objecting to Israeli president’s visit Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Anthony Albanese has defended the government’s invitation to Israeli president, Isaac Herzog, to visit, after another federal MP joined calls to cancel the visit after the Bondi terror attack. Herzog’s arrival in February will be met by a “major security response” in Sydney and planned protests nationwide from pro-Palestinian groups demonstrating against the civilian death toll from Israel’s war on Gaza. Continue reading...

events.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
events.description: More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters. More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain . Continue reading...

events.title: Gunfire and explosions heard near airport in Niger’s capital, residents say
events.description: Loud explosions and heavy gunfire were heard early Thursday near Niamey International Airport. The cause of the gunfire and whether there were any casualties in unclear. Like its neighbours, Mali and Burkina Faso, Niger is grappling with an armed insurgency by jihadist groups.

events.title: Report warns that combined casualties in Russia's war on Ukraine could hit 2 million
events.description: A new report warns that the number of soldiers killed, injured or missing in Russia's war in Ukraine could reach 2 million by spring

events.title: Heavy gunfire and explosions near airport in Niger’s capital
events.description: Heavy gunfire and explosions were heard near Niger’s international airport in Niamey on Thursday.

events.title: UN chief warns ‘law of the jungle’ is replacing rule of law
events.description: Warning that the “rule of law is being replaced by the law of the jungle,” the UN Secretary-General on Monday urged world powers to recommit to international law as the foundation of peace, justice and multilateral cooperation.

events.title: American extremist admits bankrolling ISIS terrorists, plotting US violence with homemade bomb: feds
events.description: A California man pleaded guilty to sending over $1,600 to ISIS fighters and possessing a homemade bomb packed with metal fragments in a federal terrorism case.

events.title: Haiti faces sexual violence and abuse crisis as gang violence spreads, charity warns
events.description: The number of sexual abuse cases being treated at a clinic in Haiti’s capital has tripled in the past four years as gang violence surges across the troubled Caribbean country

events.title: US congressman meets five-year-old Liam Ramos and his father at ICE detention center – as it happened
events.description: This blog has now closed. Read our latest story here Two federal officers fired their guns during the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti , according to an initial review by the Department of Homeland Security that was obtained by NBC News . Three sources told NBC News that the preliminary report, from a Customs and Border Protection internal investigation led by the agency’s Office of Professional Responsibility, was sent to congressional committees yesterday, including the House homeland security and judiciary committees. Continue reading...

events.title: Fear in Sicilian town as vast landslide risks widening
events.description: An area of the Sicilian town of Niscemi was declared off limits after a four-kilometre long stretch of the hillside collapsed on Sunday, forcing the evacuation of some 1,500 people. Though there were no deaths or injuries, experts say the gulf could extend -- and topple more houses -- when it rains again. Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni visited Wednesday, flying by helicopter over the gashed hillside and deep fissures in fields below.

events.title: Remembering the Holocaust: ‘You are here because you choose hope over hate’
events.description: The Holocaust is a warning, that hatred “can consume everything” – a message that feels more urgent than ever, the UN chief said on Tuesday, as antisemitism rages worldwide.

events.title: Scientific research in the Arctic has been a global collaboration for decades. Some researchers fear Trump's Greenland grab is threatening their work.
events.description: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: Video captures emergency crews rescuing dog trapped in icy lake during single-digit temperatures
events.description: Fire department rescues stranded dog from icy Missouri lake in dramatic mission captured on video. Dog expected to make full recovery after rescue operation.

events.title: How Israel’s West Bank security realities are reshaping the two-state debate
events.description: The West Bank remains central to Israel's security strategy as experts debate two-state solution viability following declining Palestinian terrorist incidents.

events.title: US embassy angers Danish veterans by removing flags
events.description: Danish veterans on Wednesday criticised the US embassy in Copenhagen for removing national flags put up in front of the mission to honour Danish soldiers killed in Afghanistan. The embassy later backtracked, and a US State Department spokesperson told AFP that "until an outlet reached out, we were unaware of why the flags were placed in planters outside the Embassy". FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

events.title: 1.2 million Russian soldiers killed, injured in Ukraine — report
events.description: A new report has gathered data on battlefield losses from the war in Ukraine, estimating total losses could reach 2 million by April.

events.title: US withdrawal from WHO ‘risks global safety’, agency says in detailed rebuttal
events.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a detailed statement regretting the United States decision to leave the UN agency, and declaring that it will leave both the US and the world less safe as a result.

events.title: Dozens killed in RSF drone attack in war-torn Sudan’s South Kordofan
events.description: The attack in Dilling town comes a day after Sudan's military declared an end to RSF siege there.

events.title: Thursday briefing: Will Keir Starmer’s cautious China gamble pay off?
events.description: In today’s newsletter: With China now central to the world’s green tech​ and economic future, the UK faces a ​s​eries of strategic ​discussions it can no longer postpone Good morning. The Starmer has landed. Yesterday, Keir Starmer became the first British prime minister to make the trip to China since Theresa May’s in 2018 (meaning a surprisingly large number of PMs didn’t) and has vowed to bring “stability and clarity” to the UK’s approach to Beijing . Iran | Donald Trump has warned time is running out for Tehran and said a massive US armada was moving quickly towards the country. Assisted Dying | Supporters of assisted dying will seek to force through the bill using an archaic parliamentary procedure if it continues to be blocked by the Lords. UK politics | Centrist ideas are no longer wanted in the Conservative party, Kemi Badenoch has said. Ofsted | A snap inspection of a Bristol secondary school criticised for postponing a visit by an MP who is a member of a group that advocates for Israel has found “no evidence of partisan political views”. BBC | The BBC has named senior executive Rhodri Talfan Davies as its interim director general , as the corporation continues the search for a permanent replacement for Tim Davie. Continue reading...

events.title: Inquiry calls for ban on ‘globalise the intifada’ in NSW – but only when used to incite hatred and violence
events.description: Opposition ‘deeply unimpressed’ with recommendation that ‘adds nothing except confusion’, shadow attorney general says Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A New South Wales parliamentary inquiry has recommended banning the phrase “globalise the intifada” when it is used to incite hatred, harassment, intimidation or violence, but won’t call for banning the statement outright or recommend a ban on phrases such as “from the river to sea”. The Labor MP Edmond Atalla, the chair of the inquiry, confirmed the draft recommendations to Guardian Australia ahead of a final closed meeting on Thursday, at which the Labor-led committee voted to table the report almost entirely unchanged. Continue reading...

events.title: Greetings from Mumbai, where residents take breathing space where they can find it
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: ‘We must stand up for our shared humanity - each and every day’: UN human rights chief
events.description: On the eve of International Holocaust Remembrance Day, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called on the global community to “not only to look at our past, but to reflect on our present, and to safeguard our future.”

events.title: South Sudan: UN and rights experts warn against risk of mass violence in Jonglei
events.description: The UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) is sounding the alarm over the threat of escalating violence in Jonglei state which is putting lives at risk and further weakening prospects for peace.

events.title: Rabbi attacked on NYC street on International Holocaust Remembrance Day
events.description: A rabbi was allegedly attacked in an antisemitic assault on Holocaust Remembrance Day in Queens, New York. The suspect was arrested on hate crime charges.

events.title: Video: US agents placed on leave over Pretti shooting as vigil held
events.description: US federal agents involved in a fatal shooting during an immigration raid are placed on leave. Manuel Rapalo explains.

events.title: South Korea’s ‘world-first’ AI laws face pushback amid bid to become leading tech power
events.description: The laws have been criticised by tech startups, which say they go too far, and civil society groups, which say they don’t go far enough South Korea has embarked on a foray into the regulation of AI, launching what has been billed as the most comprehensive set of laws anywhere in the world, that could prove a model for other countries, but the new legislation has already encountered pushback. The laws, which will force companies to label AI-generated content, have been criticised by local tech startups, which say they go too far, and civil society groups, which say they don’t go far enough. Add invisible digital watermarks for clearly artificial outputs such as cartoons or artwork. For realistic deepfakes, visible labels are required. “High-impact AI”, including systems used for medical diagnosis , hiring and loan approvals, will require operators to conduct risk assessments and document how decisions are made. If a human makes the final decision the system may fall outside the category. Extremely powerful AI models will require safety reports, but the threshold is set so high that government officials acknowledge no models worldwide currently meet it. Continue reading...

events.title: Video appears to show Alex Pretti spit at federal agents, violently damage SUV days before fatal CBP shooting
events.description: Newly released video appears to show Alex Pretti confronting federal agents before his fatal Minneapolis shooting during enforcement operations.

events.title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
events.description: State ariline Satena says its aircraft carrying 13 passengers and two crew "suffered a fatal accident".

events.title: Live: Sanctioned Russian oil giant Lukoil to sell foreign assets to US investment firm
events.description: Russia's oil giant Lukoil said on Thursday that it will sell its foreign assets to The Carlyle Group, a US investment firm. This comes as Russian drone strikes killed three people and wounded another person overnight in southern Ukraine, the governor of Zaporizhzhia said. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

events.title: Multiple people injured after gunfire erupts at funeral home during teen's service with hundreds in attendance
events.description: Six people were injured in a shooting at a teenager's funeral in Ferguson, Missouri, authorities confirmed. Hundreds of mourners were in attendance when gunfire erupted.

events.title: Iranian security forces gun down amateur boxer near Tehran: source
events.description: Iranian security forces allegedly killed amateur boxer Sepehr Ebrahimi during ongoing protests near Tehran. The death adds to Iran's rising protest toll of at least 6,126 people killed.

events.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal as US military builds up in Gulf
events.description: Tehran says its armed forces are ready "with their fingers on the trigger" to respond to any aggression.

events.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
events.description: Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled . At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines. The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Climate change worsened rains, floods which killed dozens in southern Africa: Study
events.description: Researchers say human-induced climate change worsened recent torrential rains and floods in southern Africa

events.title: Knife-wielding attacker vanishes after random daytime stabbing rattles affluent suburb
events.description: Woman critically injured in alleged random stabbing on popular Seattle-area trail. Suspect remains at large and considered armed and extremely dangerous.

events.title: Russian drone attack on passenger train is an ‘act of terrorism,’ Zelenskyy says
events.description: Russian drones struck a passenger train in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, killing five in what Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called an act of terrorism.

events.title: Ted Cruz urges US to arm Iranian protesters as militias threaten ‘total war’ against America
events.description: Ted Cruz responds to reports describing rapidly deteriorating situation as Iran-backed militias threaten 'total war' against America. He called for the U.S. to arm Iranian protesters.

events.title: From lunch tray to lifelong health: WHO sets global standards for school meals
events.description: For the first time ever, the World Health Organization (WHO) is providing recommendations for healthy and nutritious food in schools around the world.

events.title: Man who nearly beat Chicago train passenger to death walks free with no prison time: report
events.description: CTA passenger allegedly beaten into coma with brain injuries, broken ribs won't see attacker serve prison time under current Illinois sentencing laws.

events.title: Combined war casualties for Russia and Ukraine could hit 2 million, new report warns
events.description: A new CSIS report warns Russia-Ukraine war casualties could reach 2 million by spring 2026, with Russia reportedly suffering 1.2 million casualties so far.

events.title: Is the global economic order unravelling?
events.description: As the US pushes its 'America First' agenda, its partners are edging towards China and new alliances are being formed.

events.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‘decolonise’ its work
events.description: Development charity’s new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to “decolonise” the organisation’s work. ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements. Continue reading...

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.description: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Fourth Maine plane crash victim identified as Hawaiian chef
events.description: Hawaiian chef Nick Mastrascusa identified as victim in deadly Bangor, Maine, plane crash that killed six people during winter storm takeoff Sunday.

events.title: Gulf shipping operations grind to halt near Iran; US quietly prepares for possible strike: 'Heightened risk'
events.description: Maritime intelligence warns of heightened risks for U.S.-flagged vessels in the Persian Gulf as Iran threatens an "immediate, all-out" response to any American military action.

events.title: Border agents involved in fatal shooting of Alex Pretti placed on leave
events.description: As Trump and the Minneapolis Mayor spar over social media on immigration law enforcement, the US continues to be roiled by the killing of nurse Alex Pretti.

events.title: Trump admin rewrites nuclear safety rules. And, NTSB releases findings on D.C. crash
events.description: NPR obtains documents showing the Trump administration secretly cut nuclear safety rules to fast-track new reactors. And, investigators blame systemic failures for a deadly midair crash near D.C.

events.title: 'Russia exaggerating gains in Ukraine to push for territorial concessions'
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Christina Harward, Russia Deputy Team Lead at the Institute for the Study of War, says that the 'Russian advances are coming at a literal foot-pace' and 'this is not the picture that the Russians are trying to paint', adding that Russian casualties are astronomical. She explains that Russians are trying to diplomatically strongarm Ukraine and the West into giving up this territory, because they 'know the fight is going to be long'.

events.title: Swedish amusement park fined over 2023 roller coaster derailment that killed 1
events.description: A Swedish amusement park has been fined nearly $588,000 in connection with a fatal 2023 roller coaster derailment

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.description: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: ‘Cycle of attacks must end’: Lead UN official in Ukraine
events.description: The senior UN official in Ukraine, Matthias Schmale, has issued a condemnation of the massive overnight Russian drone and missile strike on several major Ukrainian cities, killing and injuring civilians, and knocking out energy infrastructure amid sub-zero temperatures.

events.title: Viral ‘bananas and rice’ Somali woman arrested for allegedly participating in Minneapolis riot
events.description: The viral "bananas and rice" woman was among 16 arrested during the Minneapolis riots as federal authorities escalate enforcement after deadly clashes with protesters.

events.title: US population growth at post-COVID low amid decline in net international migration
events.description: U.S. population growth hits slowest rate since COVID at just 0.5%, with the Census Bureau citing major decline in net international migration as a key factor.

events.title: China slams Trump administration over US sanctions on Cuba
events.description: China strongly condemns U.S. pressure on Cuba, calling sanctions violations of international law as diplomatic tensions escalate over decades-long embargo.

events.title: Can Venezuela’s Delcy Rodríguez become a Latin American Deng Xiaoping?
events.description: Maduro’s Sorbonne-educated successor is talking up an era of ‘reform and opening up’ modelled on China’s post-Mao boom After years of political and social upheaval, hunger and despair, the Great Helmsman departs and is replaced by a francophile economic reformer who catapults a traumatised country into a new era of prosperity and growth . That is what happened in China half a century ago when the croissant-loving communist Deng Xiaoping became paramount leader after Chairman Mao Zedong’s 1976 death and set in motion one of history’s biggest economic booms. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Don't take us to a hospital': Iran protesters treated in secret to avoid arrest
events.description: Wounded demonstrators tell the BBC they are relying on medics willing to risk their own safety by treating them at their homes.

events.title: At least five killed after Storm Kristin hits Portugal
events.description: The storm toppled trees, damaged homes and left more than 800,000 people without power.

events.title: LIVE: Iran warns of quick retaliation as Trump revives US threats
events.description: Iran pushes back after Trump says Tehran can either negotiate 'a fair and equitable deal' or face a US 'armada'.

events.title: Colombia plane crash: All 15 passengers on board killed
events.description: The aircraft carrying 15 people, including Congressman Diogenes Quintero, made last contact with air traffic control shortly after takeoff.

events.title: '25 years later we still lack the capacity to act together without the United States'
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Wednesday a standoff with the US over Greenland was "a strategic wake-up call for all of Europe", speaking alongside the leaders of Denmark and the Danish autonomous territory. Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Federico Santopinto, Senior Research Fellow at IRIS, says that 'Europe has had already several strategic wake up calls in the past, but when a new crisis comes they discover that they are still weak and dependent on the United States'.

events.title: Senior politician dies in India plane crash
events.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has paid tribute after a minister was killed in a plane crash which left no survivors.

events.title: From deepfakes to grooming: UN warns of escalating AI threats to children
events.description: The staggering amount of harmful AI-generated online content has prompted an urgent call from across the UN system for a raft of measures to protect children from abuse, exploitation and mental trauma.

events.title: Illinois teen stabs pregnant woman 70 times, knifes dog, sets home ablaze during Facebook Marketplace meetup
events.description: An Illinois teenager allegedly stabbed a pregnant mother to death dozens of times during a Facebook Marketplace meetup before setting the home on fire.

events.title: TV weatherman dies in small Idaho plane crash after aircraft clips power line
events.description: CBS2 meteorologist Roland Steadham killed in Idaho plane crash after decade-long career. The devoted father and grandfather loved recreational flying.

events.title: Commercial flight vanishes before crashing in Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including congressman
events.description: A plane crash in Colombia killed 15 near the Venezuela border with a congressman aboard. Search teams have confirmed no survivors were found.

events.title: Netanyahu sounds alarm on antisemitism at Holocaust Remembrance Day gathering
events.description: Antisemitism surge prompts leaders to gather in Jerusalem for Holocaust Remembrance Day conference. Netanyahu warns ideology threatens Western civilization.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Head of US Africa bureau urges staff to highlight US ‘generosity’ despite aid cuts
events.description: Email sent to diplomats by state department office’s new boss is labelled ‘racist’ after dismissing Africa as a priority US diplomats have been encouraged to “unabashedly and aggressively” remind African governments about the “generosity” of the American people, according to a leaked email sent to staff in the US state department’s Bureau of African Affairs this January and obtained by the Guardian. “It’s not gauche to remind these countries of the American people’s generosity in containing HIV/Aids or alleviating famine,” says the email. Continue reading...

events.title: Starmer-Xi meeting live: UK prime minister says he wants ‘more sophisticated’ relationship with China
events.description: Starmer tells Xi Jinping during Beijing meeting that it has been ‘too long’ since a British PM has visited China. Full report: Xi says he hopes China and UK can ‘rise above differences’ For more context on today’s Starmer - Xi meeting, China is the world’s second-biggest economy and Britain’s third-largest trading partner – to which it exports £45bn of goods and services a year – so it is no surprise the UK has turned to Beijing in its search for economic reliability. As the Guardian’s political editor Pippa Crerar reported earlier today, the UK does not rank among the top 10 of China’s trading partners but the Beijing leadership has spied a political opportunity to improve links with one of Washington’s closest allies at a time of deep uncertainty in the transatlantic alliance. Continue reading...

events.title: Marco Rubio tells senators Venezuela transition won't be fast or easy
events.description: At his first Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing since U.S. forces seized Nicolás Maduro, Secretary of State Marco Rubio warns the U.S. could still use force to pressure Venezuela's government.

events.title: Doctors share disturbing accounts of Iran crackdown
events.description: In Iran, the climate of fear has been restored after the clerics who run this country successfully crushed nationwide revolt.

events.title: Small plane crashes in rural area of northeast Colombia, killing all 15 people on board
events.description: Authorities say a small plane has crashed in a rural area of Norte de Santander province in northeast Colombia, killing all 15 people on board

events.title: World News in Brief: Deadly shipwrecks in the Mediterranean, Duterte trial update, final hostage remains recovered in Gaza, FAO boosts farming in Haiti
events.description: The UN migration agency, IOM, expressed deep concern on Monday over multiple deadly shipwrecks that are believed to have taken place over the past ten days across the Central Mediterranean.

events.title: Substance sprayed on Rep Ilhan Omar reportedly identified as apple cider vinegar; FBI investigating
events.description: A man accused of attacking Rep. Ilhan Omar at a town hall event allegedly sprayed apple cider vinegar on the congresswoman. Anthony James Kazmierczak, 55, is charged with assault.

events.title: Filipino mayor unharmed after apparent RPG attack on car in broad daylight
events.description: Mayor Akmad Ampatuan was unharmed after attackers targeted his vehicle with an apparent rocket-propelled grenade in the southern province of Maguindanao del Sur.

events.title: Heavy gunfire and blasts heard near airport in Niger's capital
events.description: The airport houses an air force base and is about 10km (six miles) from the presidential place.

events.title: Man guilty of assault after Barron Trump reported attack to UK police
events.description: Donald Trump's son told officers he had seen the victim being beaten up during a video call in January 2025.

events.title: Minnesota: Agents in Pretti shooting placed on leave — media
events.description: Two agents involved in the shooting of Alex Pretti have reportedly been placed on leave. Meanwhile, a suspect who targeted Democratic congresswoman Ilhan Omar has a criminal history and made pro-Trump posts, police say.

events.title: Nigerian police fire tear gas, injuring protester in Lagos floating slum protests
events.description: In tonight's edition: Nigerian police clash with crowds angry about the way that hundreds of homes have been demolished in the Makoko floating village. Also, Kigali is suing the UK for £100 million due as part of a scrapped agreement with the former British government for the African nation to take in people deported from the UK. Plus US YouTuber IShowSpeed is the latest member of the diaspora to be granted Ghanaian citizenship.

events.title: Security Council LIVE: Ambassadors debate as Middle East crises mount
events.description: The UN Security Council is holding a high-level open debate on the Middle East which is expected to focus on the Gaza peace plan – including the role of President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace – the continuing humanitarian crisis in the enclave and turmoil in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, following the demolition of UNRWA’s headquarters there. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Driver rams car repeatedly into doors of NYC Jewish site, suspect detained
events.description: A driver was taken into custody after police say the individual intentionally and repeatedly rammed a vehicle into the Chabad Lubavitch World Headquarters in New York City.

events.title: Skier suffers brutal mauling after stepping within 10 feet of snow leopard for photo, video shows
events.description: Female skier survives snow leopard mauling in China's Fuyun County after authorities warned tourists about predator sightings near hotel, according to reports.

events.title: Trump says government will 'de-escalate' in Minnesota following Pretti shooting
events.description: The killing of Alex Pretti over the weekend led Minnesota officials and locals to renew calls for Trump to end his immigration operation there.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing called for a "comprehensive strategic partnership" to deepen ties amid global uncertainty.

events.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

events.title: UK's Starmer seeks fresh start with China as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer told Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday that he wants to build a "sophisticated relationship" between the two countries. Starmer's four-day visit to China is the first by a British leader in eight years, and comes amid rising tensions between the UK and the US.

events.title: Landslide causes homes to fall off cliff edge
events.description: Heavy rain has tiggered a landslide in southern Sicily causing the edge of a town to collapse and forcing the evacuation of more than 1,500 people.

events.title: Amazon to axe thousands of jobs globally
events.description: Amazon has told staff it plans to cut around 16,000 jobs globally as part of efforts to streamline operations and reduce bureaucracy across the business.

events.title: Regime crackdown: Life inside Iran
events.description: 👉Listen to The World with Richard Engel and Yalda Hakim on your podcast app👈

events.title: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties as US tariffs reshape global trade
events.description: Vietnam and the European Union have upgraded their relationship to a comprehensive strategic partnership, Vietnam’s highest diplomatic level

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: The leaders of Britain and China have called for a “comprehensive strategic partnership” to deepen ties amid global uncertainty

events.title: Young people must be ‘truly involved’ in transforming education
events.description: With young people under 30 making up more than half of the global population and over 272 million children and youth still out of school, their participation in shaping education is becoming increasingly vital.

events.title: Pope Leo calls for world free from persecution while honoring Holocaust victims
events.description: Pope Leo calls Holocaust Remembrance Day a "painful remembrance" during a Vatican audience, urging vigilance against genocide and building societies rooted in respect.

events.title: 'I don't let bullies win,' says US congresswoman Omar after substance thrown at her
events.description: The Minnesota Democrat was uninjured and continued to speak at her event, after being sprayed with an unidentified liquid.

events.title: 'I couldn't save them' - US mum's horror as three sons die falling through pond ice
events.description: Their mother says she tried to rescue them by lifting them out but the ice kept breaking.

events.title: China warns against US ‘military adventurism’ as Iran tensions escalate
events.description: China warns against US ‘military adventurism’ as Iran tensions escalate

events.title: China warns Australia against taking back control of key port in Darwin
events.description: China's envoy says Beijing will 'take measures' to defend Chinese firm's interests if Canberra takes over Port Darwin.

events.title: Venezuela’s police, military pledge loyalty to interim President Rodriguez
events.description: Delcy Rodriguez receives loyalty pledge weeks after dozens killed in US military operation to abduct Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
events.description: Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities. Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Five-year-old deported to Honduras despite being US citizen is latest child victim of Trump crackdown
events.description: Mother whose visa application was pending says she will send girl back to US soon accompanied by another relative Five-year-old Génesis Ester Gutiérrez Castellanos misses her cousins, classmates and kindergarten teachers in Austin, Texas. Despite being a US citizen, she was deported on 11 January alongside her mother, Karen Guadalupe Gutiérrez Castellanos, to Honduras, a country Génesis had never known. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were acting on an administrative deportation order against Gutiérrez, 26, issued in 2019, before Génesis was born. Continue reading...

events.title: Two friends, an Israeli and a Palestinian, believe peace is possible after war
events.description: A Palestinian man and his Israeli friend are dedicating themselves to a peaceful coexistence in the aftermath of the devastating war in Gaza.

events.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
events.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

events.title: China executes 11 people tied to Myanmar scam compounds
events.description: The 11 members of gangs based in northern Myanmar were sentenced to death in September. Beijing has been cracking down on cyberscam compounds in Southeast Asia in recent years.

events.title: Sicily landslide forces evacuation of 1,500
events.description: A landslide in southern Sicily has homes balanced at the edge of a cliff following days of rain. Officials have said some people won't be able to return to living in their homes.

events.title: Protesters rally at Texas detention centre holding 5-year-old from Minneapolis
events.description: Texas state police used tear gas on Wednesday to disperse about 100 protesters outside a US immigration detention facility in Dilley, where demonstrators demanded the release of Liam Conejo Ramos, a 5-year-old boy from Minneapolis detained under President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.

events.title: Federal Reserve defies Trump to hold interest rates steady
events.description: The US Federal Reserve has defied pressure from President Donald Trump by holding interest rates steady. The policy announcement was partly overshadowed by ongoing tensions with the administration. Fed Chairman Jerome Powell – who is facing a criminal probe he describes as politically motivated – insisted the US central bank would maintain its independence. Also in the show: the US dollar slides to its lowest level in four years, and Paris Fashion Week deals with the rise of ultra-fast fashion.

events.title: ICE victim wasn't a 'would-be assassin', Trump says
events.description: Donald Trump has appeared to distance himself from controversial remarks by senior members of his administration about ICE shooting victim Alex Pretti.

events.title: Swiss politician fined for shooting a pistol at Madonna and Child poster
events.description: A Swiss politician has been fined for firing a sport pistol at an auction poster of a 14th-century painting of Madonna and Child and then posting images of the damage online

events.title: UN says Gaza crisis remains dire, children hardest hit
events.description: Despite a modest increase in humanitarian assistance, the situation in Gaza remains “dire”, with children among the hardest hit by shortages of shelter, basic services and education, the United Nations said on Tuesday.

events.title: Between fear and survival: Women and girls flee violence in northern Syria
events.description: When fighting recently intensified near her neighbourhood in Aleppo, in northern Syria, Fatima and her family had to run.

events.title: Keeping people warm amid hostilities and harsh winter weather in Ukraine
events.description: As people in war-torn Ukraine face the coldest winter in more than a decade, authorities and humanitarians are working to help them stay warm, particularly the most vulnerable residents.

events.title: Texas killer asks victims' families for forgiveness before becoming first execution of 2026
events.description: Texas carried out the nation’s first execution of the year, putting to death a man convicted of killing his ex-girlfriend and her new boyfriend in a 1998 double murder.

events.title: Career criminal accused of killing elderly woman in violent home invasion after skipping court days earlier
events.description: Texas man with prior convictions allegedly kills elderly woman during home invasion days after missing court appearance. Both suspects shot by victim.

events.title: DHS honors Illinois woman whose corpse was allegedly abused by illegal immigrant freed under sanctuary laws
events.description: DHS honored an Illinois woman, Megan Bos, who was allegedly killed by an illegal immigrant who walked free under sanctuary laws before an ICE arrest.

events.title: From 700 murdered relatives to 3 survivors: Holocaust descendant leads Israeli forces after Oct 7 attacks
events.description: Israeli colonel whose parents survived Holocaust continues military service at the age of 56, serving over 3,600 days in reserves including Gaza operations.

events.title: The return of inflation may poison Labor’s second-term agenda and scare more voters to the fringes
events.description: As economic grievance grows in the electorate, an interest rate hike is the last thing our fraught politics needs Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Cost of living has been bubbling along as the number-one issue for Australian households, and now it threatens to hijack the Albanese government’s second-term agenda. The return of high and rising inflation is not only a blow to workers who were finally starting to see some real growth in their wages through 2025. It also risks further polarising and antagonising our already fraught politics. Continue reading...

events.title: A new blow for UNRWA as headquarters in East Jerusalem 'set on fire'
events.description: The head of embattled UN relief agency for Palestinians, UNRWA, has condemned reports that its headquarters in East Jerusalem have been set alight deliberately.

events.title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia
events.description: China executes 11 members of the Ming family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

events.title: ‘You’re not human:’ A legal limbo for Russian nationals in Ukraine
events.description: As some Russians symbolically destroy their passports, others officially part with it through a drawn out process.

events.title: Banks shut, futures uncertain one year after M23 rebels seized DRC’s Goma
events.description: A year since the M23's lightning offensive led to the fall of North Kivu's capital, residents struggle to make a living.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Mexico’s president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‘sovereign’ decision
events.description: Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‘zero’ oil would go to Cuba Mexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba , the country’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was “sovereign” and not a response to pressure from the US. Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island’s biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month. Continue reading...

events.title: China executes 11 people linked to Myanmar scam operation
events.description: Beijing has stepped up cooperation with south-east Asian nations to crack down on the multibillion-dollar industry China on Thursday executed 11 people linked to Myanmar criminal gangs, including “key members” involved in scam operations, state media reported. Scam compounds have flourished in Myanmar’s lawless borderlands, part of a multibillion-dollar illicit industry. Continue reading...

events.title: Chinese man who filmed evidence of Xinjiang rights abuses is granted asylum in US
events.description: Lawyer for Guan Heng, whose exposed evidence of persecution of Uyghurs, says he is ‘textbook example of why asylum should exist’ A US immigration judge has granted asylum to a Chinese national who he said had a “well founded fear” of persecution if sent back to China after exposing alleged human rights abuses against Uyghurs there. Guan Heng applied for asylum after arriving in the US illegally in 2021. He has been in custody since being swept up in an immigration enforcement operation in August last year as part of a mass deportation campaign by the Trump administration. Continue reading...

events.title: Spain will grant legal status to immigrants lacking authorization
events.description: Spain's government announced Tuesday it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization.

events.title: Confusion, anger in post-coup Guinea-Bissau
events.description: The opposition alleges that the ousted president staged his own coup to avoid defeat in the last election. Meanwhile, the country's political institutions have been left in limbo as the country gears up for fresh polls.

events.title: US Fed keeps rates unchanged despite Trump pressure
events.description: The Federal Reserve has decided to keep interest rates between 3.5% and 3.75%. Two Fed governors voted against the move, and instead backed a rate cut, while 10 officials were in favor of leaving rates the same.

events.title: French Senate approves draft bill to simplify return of colonial-era artefacts
events.description: The French Senate on Wednesday adopted a draft legislation to facilitate the return of artworks and other prized artefacts looted during the country’s colonial era. This new procedure could help address requests already submitted by various countries, including Mali, Algeria and Benin.

events.title: Bangladesh's ousted leader Hasina denounces the upcoming election from her exile in India
events.description: Bangladesh’s ousted leader Sheikh Hasina has slammed the country’s upcoming election after her party was barred from the polls, remarks that could deepen tensions ahead of the pivotal vote next month

events.title: Rwanda sues the UK over controversial migrant deal
events.description: Rwanda has said it is suing the United Kingdom to seek payments over an aborted, controversial migrant deal under which the East African nation was to host deported asylum seekers from the European country

events.title: Putin is hosting Syria's interim leader for talks, with Russian military bases on the agenda
events.description: Syria’s interim leader has arrived in Moscow for his second time in less than four months for talks, which are expected to focus on the future of Russian military bases in the country

events.title: Independent experts alarmed by child rights violations in US immigration procedures
events.description: UN-appointed independent human rights experts have raised alarm over violations of children’s rights during US immigration procedures, nearly a year after federal funding for legal representation for unaccompanied minors was terminated.

events.title: What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios
events.description: From regime change to retaliation, the BBC's Frank Gardner outlines possible outcomes of US strikes on Iran.

events.title: Panic on crowded Ukraine train - passenger describes moment of Russian drone strike
events.description: The BBC speaks to a person who was aboard a train on which five people died after it was targeted by drones.

events.title: Amazon confirms 16,000 job cuts after accidental email
events.description: The technology giant confirmed the redundancies hours after it told staff in an email sent in error.

events.title: Gold surges past $5,500 amid Iran tensions, weakening US dollar
events.description: Precious metal hits fresh record as US President Donald Trump renews threats against Iran.

events.title: Police probe explosive device thrown at Indigenous protest in Australia
events.description: Man charged with throwing explosive device into a crowd at Invasion Day protest in Western Australia's Perth.

events.title: U.S. allies looking to China for deals as Trump threats them with tariffs
events.description: President Trump's tariffs and rhetoric have spurred some longtime U.S. allies to diversify their trade ties away from the U.S. Some are going cap-in-hand to Asian superpowers China and India.

events.title: Germany updates: Deutsche Bank announces record profits
events.description: Germany's biggest bank has announced record profits just one day after its offices were searched as part of an investigation into money laundering. DW has more.

events.title: Court faults Netherlands over Caribbean island climate risks
events.description: Judges have ruled that the Dutch government has been failing to adequately protect its citizens on the island of Bonaire from climate threats.

events.title: Iraq PM candidate Maliki slams US ‘blatant interference’ after Trump threat
events.description: Iraq’s leading candidate for prime minister, Nouri al-Maliki, on Wednesday denounced what he called Washington’s “blatant interference” after President Donald Trump threatened to end all US support if Maliki takes office.

events.title: Plane crash kills 15 including politician
events.description: A small passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including a congressman.

events.title: Al-Maliki is defiant after Trump threatens to withdraw US support for Iraq
events.description: Former Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki has expressed defiance after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to withdraw support for Iraq if he returns to power

events.title: Gaza ceasefire improves aid access, but children still face deadly conditions
events.description: The fragile ceasefire in the Gaza Strip is making a difference to the lives of over a million children, and improving overall access to food - but more aid still needs to enter.

events.title: NASA research plane lands on belly, sending sparks flying, after 'mechanical issue'
events.description: A NASA aircraft had to perform a "gear-up landing" in Houston due to a mechanical problem, a NASA spokesperson indicated in a post on X.

events.title: CBP/Border Patrol agents placed on administrative leave after deadly confrontation with Alex Pretti
events.description: Two U.S. CBP agents who fired weapons in the deadly confrontation with Alex Pretti in Minnesota have been placed on administrative leave.

events.title: UK reopens Chagos Islands talks with US following Trump criticism of deal: reports
events.description: Chagos Islands talks between UK and U.S. reopened after President Donald Trump called the Mauritius deal an "act of great stupidity" as British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says discussions have resumed.

events.title: Trump says Iran called 'numerous' times to make deal as carrier enters Middle East waters
events.description: President Donald Trump indicated Iran is seeking negotiations as the USS Abraham Lincoln carrier enters the region and protests continue inside Iran.

events.title: During heated hearing, Rubio insists US action in Venezuela will lead to prosperity and security
events.description: The US Secretary of State remained robustly on message when asked about the legality of Maduro's removal, plans for oil sales, and the future of Venezuela.

events.title: Israel seeks ‘more exits than entries’ at Gaza’s Rafah as Egypt objects
events.description: Demands from Israel fuel fears of engineered displacement of Palestinians from devastated Gaza.

events.title: Syria grants immediate citizenship to Kurds in wake of gains against SDF
events.description: Interior Minister Anas Khattab's order includes all listed as stateless and sets February 5 as deadline for its rollout.

events.title: China executes 11 linked to Myanmar scam operations: State media
events.description: Among the executed were members of the "Ming family criminal group".

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Marco Rubio defends Trump's Venezuela policy in heated hearing
events.description: The top US diplomat testified before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. In early January, the United States seized Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro in an operation and brought him to New York to face charges.

events.title: Rubio details Trump administration's plan to control sale of Venezuelan oil
events.description: The Trump administration plans to handle the sale of tens of millions of barrels of oil from Venezuela and oversee where the money flows, Secretary of State Marco Rubio told a Senate hearing on Wednesday, adding that the revenue would initially be dedicated to basic government services such as policing and health care, subject to Washington's oversight.

events.title: US says aid will resume while Somali officials deny causing disruption leading to suspension
events.description: The United States say it is lifting a suspension of aid to Somalia

events.title: Latin American leaders call for unity against growing political polarization
events.description: Latin American leaders have gathered for a development forum, calling for regional unity amid increasing political polarization and recent U.S. intervention in Venezuela

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.description: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: South African school turns phone-free hoping to improve pupils' concentration
events.description: After noticing that attention deficit disorders had sharply increased among pupils in the past five years, a Cape Town high school decided to turn phone-free. Expecting a backlash, it got none. This comes as increasingly more countries are worrying about the impact of phone use and social media on children and teenagers' learning capacity and concentration. So far, 400 South African schools have adopted this measure.

events.title: French lawmakers approve bill to end ‘marital duty’ after consent concerns
events.description: French lawmakers unanimously approved a bill on Wednesday to end the notion of “marital duty”, following criticism from women’s rights groups that it undermines sexual consent and enables marital rape. Backed by more than 120 MPs, the bill clarifies that cohabitation does not oblige spouses to have sex and now heads to the Senate for approval.

events.title: What is Nipah virus? The highly lethal disease causing concern across Asia
events.description: Airports across Asia have put urgent steps in place to stop the spread of a highly lethal virus.

events.title: Assailant convicted after Barron Trump calls London police to report crime he saw on video
events.description: A Russian man has been convicted in a London court of beating a woman in a crime reported by the youngest son of U.S. President Donald Trump

events.title: Limited access restored to Syria’s Al Hol camp amid security concerns
events.description: United Nations agencies have regained limited access to Syria’s Al Hol camp and resumed the delivery of essential supplies after days of disruption caused by a volatile security situation, the UN Deputy Spokesperson said on Friday.

events.title: China infiltrates key Pacific territory of Micronesia with infrastructure projects as US urged to act
events.description: China opens new runway in Micronesia's Yap islands, raising serious U.S. defense concerns in this strategically vital Pacific region amid growing tensions.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Huge landslide leaves Sicilian homes teetering on cliff edge
events.description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni was given an aerial tour of a southern Sicilian town where days of heavy rains triggered a massive landslide

events.title: Yemen: Security Council votes on final extension of Hudaydah Mission
events.description: The Security Council adopted a resolution on Tuesday that renews the mandate of the UN Mission in the Yemeni port city of Hudaydah for a final two-month period through 31 March of this year.

events.title: Indians pay tribute after Arijit Singh retires at 38 as Bollywood singer
events.description: Singh has been one of the most loved and recognisable voices of Bollywood for more than a decade.

events.title: Europe must act urgently and stop outsourcing defence, says EU's Kallas
events.description: The EU foreign policy chief's remarks come days after Nato's secretary general said Europe needed the US for its defence.

events.title: Deutsche Bank offices raided in money laundering probe
events.description: Officials searched offices in Frankfurt and Berlin in relation to "past business relationships".

events.title: Ecuador says ICE agent attempted to enter its Minneapolis consulate
events.description: A complaint has been filed by Ecuador, whose consular staff prevented the agent from entering.

events.title: US YouTube star IShowSpeed to get Ghanaian passport as Africa tour ends
events.description: Ghana's foreign minister says the influencer is a "worthy ambassador", but some Ghanaians criticised the move.

events.title: Clashes between government troops and Tigrayan forces erupt in Ethiopia
events.description: 'Deteriorating' situation causes suspension of flights, security and diplomatic sources say.

events.title: Car ramming at largest synagogue in Brooklyn
events.description: A man has been arrested after repeatedly ramming his car into Brooklyn’s largest synagogue.

events.title: Exiled leader Hasina denounces upcoming Bangladesh polls after party ban
events.description: Ousted premier says the exclusion of her Awami League party "deepens resentment" on Muhammad Yunus's interim government.

events.title: Bangladesh election: Is the military still a power behind the scenes?
events.description: Bangladesh's era of coups and military rule may be over for now, but the army remains a potent force impacting politics

events.title: Trump’s troop deployment in US cities cost almost $500m in 2025
events.description: The Congressional Budget Office estimates that ongoing military operations in US cities will cost $93m a month.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Canadian ex-Olympian pleads not guilty to 17 felonies including drug trafficking
events.description: Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, 44, ‘turned to a life of crime’ after his snowboarding career ended Ryan Wedding, the Canadian former Olympic snowboarder accused of cocaine distribution and orchestrating several murders, appeared on Monday in a southern California courtroom for arraignment. The 44-year-old has been charged with drug trafficking, conspiracy to murder, witness tampering and money laundering, among other charges. Authorities allege that after his snowboarding career, Wedding “turned to a life of crime” as a narcotics trafficker and led an organization that moved cocaine from South America to the US and Canada. Continue reading...

events.title: A cabal of male Liberals signals Ley’s reign is ending. But the day of a colleague’s memorial is obscene timing
events.description: As images of a secret meeting were splashed all over the media, it became clear the internal plot to oust the leader has descended into political melodrama The images of a cabal of rightwing Liberal men gathering for clandestine talks to overthrow the party’s first female leader – hours before a memorial service for a late former colleague, no less – confirmed two things. First, the internal plot to oust Sussan Ley has descended into a political melodrama. Continue reading...

events.title: M 5.5 - 9 km ESE of Dianga, China
events.description: PAGER - YELLOW ShakeMap - VII DYFI? - IV Time 2026-01-26 06:56:02 UTC 2026-01-26 06:56:02 UTC at epicenter Location 34.028°N 103.305°E Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: M 4.7 - 40 km S of Evanston, Wyoming
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - V DYFI? - V Time 2026-01-22 14:49:20 UTC 2026-01-22 14:49:20 UTC at epicenter Location 40.911°N 110.875°W Depth 14.72 km (9.15 mi)

events.title: EU signs 'mother of all deals' to boost trade with India
events.description: The European Union has signed what India's prime minister has called "the mother of all deals" to boost trade with India. For Europe, the move seeks to hedge against its unpredictable ties to the U.S.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.description: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: UK's Keir Starmer visits China as Beijing courts US allies
events.description: Keir Starmer is in China for the first trip by a British prime minister since 2018. He is the latest in a string of European leaders to visit recently, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz soon to follow.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.description: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: Budapest mayor charged over Pride parade
events.description: Prosecutors in Hungary are moving against Budapest’s mayor, Gergely Karacsony, after last year's Pride went ahead despite a police ban. The case is being handled without a court hearing and as elections approach.

events.title: Hungary: Cabinet member uses vulgar slur to insult Roma
events.description: Transportation Minister Janos Lazar says Hungary doesn't need foreign workers and crudely joked that Roma should clean dirty toilets in their stead. Will his comments cost Viktor Orban's party in upcoming elections?

events.title: Inside the Philippines' struggle for rural health care
events.description: The Philippines' "doctors to the barrios" model shows how workforce shortages, intersected with governance, financing and system design, reveal why rural care remains fragile despite years of reforms.

events.title: Champions League: Arsenal finish first place, five English teams in top 8
events.description: Kai Havertz scored on his first start for nearly a year as Arsenal completed a flawless league phase campaign, making it eight wins out of eight in the Champions League with victory over Kairat Almaty (3-2).

events.title: Senegal coach receives five-match ban for ‘unsporting conduct’ at AFCON final
events.description: The Confederation of African Football announced Wednesday a series of sanctions affecting both Senegal and Morocco following controversial incidents during the AFCON final, citing "unsporting" behaviour and conduct. Senegal coach Pape Thiaw was banned for five matches, and the Senegal Football Federation was fined $615,000.

events.title: US says ICE agents will only have advisory role at Winter Olympics in Italy
events.description: A US Immigration and Customs Enforcement unit deployed to Italy for the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics will not conduct patrols and will serve only in an advisory role, Washington’s ambassador said on Wednesday. The deployment has caused an outcry in Italy because of the Trump administration's often brutal crackdown on immigration in the US.

events.title: Xi Jinping's repeated purges cast doubt on his judgment, observer says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Lynette Ong, Distinguished Professor of Chinese Politics at the University of Toronto, says that the removal of General Zhang Youxia, Senior Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, is just the latest in a long series of purges and calls into question President Xi Jinping's judgment. Zhang Youxia is being investigated for suspected serious violations of discipline and law.

events.title: American TikTok users claim app is censoring 'Epstein' and ICE criticism
events.description: TikTok recently changed hands in the US, giving a consortium of mainly American investors – run by Trump ally Larry Ellison – control of its US operations. Since then, American TikTok users claim that they're unable to write the word "Epstein" in messages on the app, and accuse TikTok of suppressing content critical of President Donald Trump, as well as censoring videos about ICE raids in Minneapolis. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Tyson Fury announces comeback fight - and it'll screen on Netflix
events.description: Tyson Fury has confirmed his return to boxing with a comeback fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov.

events.title: South Korea's former first lady jailed for 20 months for corruption
events.description: The wife of South Korea's former president Yoon Suk Yeol - who was ousted over a martial law bid - has been jailed for 20 months for corruption.

events.title: What to know about Gaza's Rafah crossing, which could open within days
events.description: The Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt could open within days

events.title: Chaos erupts in Somalia's parliament over proposed constitutional amendments
events.description: Scuffles and shouting erupted during a joint session of Somalia’s parliament on Wednesday

events.title: Al Habtoor Group exits Lebanon and lays off employees after dispute with authorities
events.description: Al Habtoor Group, based in the United Arab Emirates, is closing its operations in Lebanon and laying off all employees

events.title: Sarah Mullally confirmed as archbishop of Canterbury, first woman to lead the church
events.description: Sarah Mullally was confirmed as archbishop of Canterbury on Wednesday, becoming the first woman to lead the Church of England

events.title: From family farm to climate tech: How one Kenyan woman is helping farmers outsmart drought
events.description: “Giving up is not an option - so many people depend on you,” the words of Maryanne Gichanga, a participant in a UN supported initiative, which aims to help farmers in Kenya find solutions to alleviate the pressures of climate change on agriculture production.

events.title: Georgia assistant principal accused of stealing nearly $1K in Walmart merchandise at self-checkout
events.description: Georgia assistant principal allegedly caught shoplifting $1,000 worth of items from Walmart using self-checkout "stacking" method. Educator placed on leave.

events.title: Spain legalizes up to 500,000 undocumented migrants, sparking backlash
events.description: Spain announced plans to grant legal status to 500,000 undocumented migrants over three years, taking the opposite approach from Trump's border crackdown.

events.title: French lawmakers declare 'battle for free minds' after approving social media ban for children under 15
events.description: French lawmakers paved the way for a bill banning social media for children under 15, following Australia's lead in protecting children from digital harm.

events.title: Witkoff celebrates 'new day in the Middle East' after final Israeli hostage is returned from Gaza
events.description: All hostages from Gaza have returned home as Trump administration completes historic Middle East diplomatic achievement, marking end of painful chapter.

events.title: North Korea launches short-range ballistic missiles into sea, show of force ahead of political meetings
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's regime tests ballistic missiles as tensions rise in the region ahead of a massive political party gathering.
